benchmark_details.name: BinSum
benchmark_details.overview: BinSum is a comprehensive benchmark and dataset of over 557K binary functions, designed to evaluate the performance of large language models in binary code summarization, including a novel semantic similarity metric.
benchmark_details.data_type: binary functions with ground truth summaries

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the ability of large language models to summarize binary code and understand its semantics.

data.source: Constructed from 44 open-source projects totaling 11,475,734 lines of code, generating diverse binaries.
data.annotation: Ground truth summaries are based on developer-written code comments extracted from source code.

methodology.calculation: Similarities calculated using embeddings from pretrained models like BERT and XLNet.
methodology.interpretation: Higher semantic similarity scores indicate better alignment between generated summaries and ground truth.
methodology.validation: Benchmark validated through extensive evaluations on several LLMs and manual analyses.
